oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Model 1850 Foot Officer's Sword of Second Lieutenant Joseph W. Miller
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This Model 1850 foot officer's sword has "Jos. W. Miller" and "5th O.V. I" engraved on the scabbard. Miller rose from private to second lieutenant in the 5th Ohio Volunteer Infantry, which began the war in the Army of the Potomac. In 1863, as part of the 20th Corps, they moved to Sherman's army. According to family information, the original surname was "Mond," a German Jewish family name and Miller won a medal for bravery. He was the son of Adam Mond who became Adam Miller.
